SENT.plain: OBJECTIVES: To report a rare cause of spinal subdural hematoma
SETTING: A tertiary care university hospital in Andhra Pradesh, India
METHODS: Detailed evaluation and reporting of a case admitted in the hospital
RESULTS: A case of antiphospholipid antibody syndrome (APS) was found to present with spontaneous spinal subdural hematoma and paraplegia
This is a very rare presentation of APS
CONCLUSION: This article describes a rare case of APS presenting with disseminated bleeding and spontaneous spinal subdural hematoma, resulting in paraplegia
